text: Absloutly love it. One of the best sandwiches i had in montreal . Ask for the best sellers and go got them.

Probably the best sandwiches I've ever eaten. I love it. The staff is super nice and helpful, the portions are generous and the variety of sandwiches and sauces to choose from is great. The guy behind the counter helped us to understand the menu (because we don't speak a word of French) and even brought us our food to the table because it was very crowded. And they also have free wifi and refills. For about 10$ you get a great experience and a full tummy for the rest of the day. All in all the perfect spot.
Great people. Great food. All halal. The kids had a great time. Nice fries. Now I'm writing more because yelp requires it.

Had a very good chicken mustard sandwich. I was surprised, I love sandwiches like this ones. Plus fries were good, very fresh, they use good oil. The environment is not that cozy, wild green apple colours that make run away from there but at least food is good. I have been there a couple of times and there isn't many people probably because the decor and setup is not great but sandwiches are really good.

Tried this place out recently. The sandwiches really are very delicious and filling, great sauces and fries... The only downside was the service... The guy who served us was extremely rude and not at all helpful. Because of that it was a real turn off as his attitude towards us put us off.

C'est le 1er kebab que je teste à Montréal et quelle déception. L'accueil est mitigé, limite je m'en foutiste. J'ai pris un " Saint Michel " car il ressemblait le plus à l'original, la viande était caoutchouteuse, on ne sait pas combien de temps ils gardent leur viande, le pain n'est pas très bon non plus. Les frites sont pas mal en revanche, elles font penser à celle du mcdo.

J'avais déjà entendu parler d'eux à l'UQAM : "Psst.. Il y a un nouveau grec pas loin", "ça te dit un sandwich comme à Paris". En France, on raffole de grecs, un pain traditionnel garni de salades, tomates, oignons qu'on rempli de viande (grec ou steak, poulet, bacon, galettes de pommes de terres, cordon bleu, etc) qu'on accompagne de frites. Ils ne vendent pas encore le vrai grec mais c'est tout comme car leurs sandwichs sont au top ! 

Donc histoire de prendre un petit sandwich à emporter, je suis passée par là. Vraiment pas déçu, les employés étaient super accueillants, La décoration, rien à dire !! C'était très propre et le service était super rapide. J'ai commandé un Louvre (Oui, les sandwichs ont des noms de monuments et de lieux connus de Paris, c'est original) : Steak, bacon halal, uf et fromage cheddar ! 

C'était chaud, bon, et pas trop lourd ! Je suis partie à mon cours de danse juste après sans soucis et le ventre rempli
